document.title: W164 Replanting Corn - In a Failed Roundupâ„¢ Ready Corn Stand

author.organization: The University of Tennessee Agricultural Extension Service

document.abstract: In spring 2007, a widespread freeze occurred that led to the replanting of about 200,000 acres of corn in Tennessee. In most years, replant decisions have to be made on a limited number of acres when corn fields have insufficient stands for optimum yields. Producers are then forced to make a number of decisions quickly, because planting delays, particularly into mid-May, can greatly affect yield potential of the replanted crop.
